data.title: Water tiles are scorchable
data.body:
It is possible to scorch water tiles.

Repro: Nuking the sea tiles themselves doesn't work. But nuke some land directly next to the sea tiles and both the land and sea tiles will be scorched.

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/8707714/OpenRA.Game_2012_06_28_13_20_45_328.png

data.title: Harvester bug fix and configurable search radius values
Authentication
data.body:
Flexible way: authentication based on remote essences
How can this work
1) How to login in OpenRA
     before joining the server
     after joining the server
2) What's happening in background
     OpenRA host/server sends [http|...] request getting xml page in return which contains proper hashes.
     If login succeed, client is logged in, hurrah!!! ( there can be different access levels on dedicated servers)
3) What is about remote host?
     2 fields in their CMS/Forums database(username and password) which actually can refer to existing fields.
     \+ additional OpenRA Authentication script which will work with cms and OpenRA hosts replies.
4) Why this is good
     It allows official accounts on official OpenRA Forums as long as flexible amount of communities ( users can use this authentication with their own forums )
     so login name would be like: (ihptru@open-ra.org)
     ( official forums can have coded in shortcuts like ihptru@OpenRA where OpenRA would refer to open-ra.org )
## Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/98191-authentication?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: small fixes and the like
data.body: I will start fixing the smaller issues and of course polish the d2k mod.

data.title: infantry can now garrison church for "high point" sight bonus
data.body: This implements #2054 without touching the source code.

data.title: Units avoid friendly projectiles and path around them
data.body: Units now path around danger zones created by projectiles and actively avoid sitting idle or attacking inside a danger zone.

data.title: need WorldRenderer.Font like Game.Renderer.Font
data.body: To convert the tagStrings (primary, fake...) in SelectionDecorations.cs and the CTRL + NUMBER pip groups from SHPs to text I need something like WorldRenderer.Font which draws the text dynamically onto an actor. I don't know if it already exists or how to create my own.

data.title: Spec view should have contrast on chat
[editor] create a category tag for tiles and sort by them
data.body: mods/tilesets/*.yaml should get a `category:` option like `category: cliff` so that the tiles can be sorted by them without messing with any IDs (which might break maps). This will make the life for mappers easier as they don't have to scroll so much searching for the next tile that fits here. Especially useful for Dune 2000 where the tileset is auto-generated by the TilesetBuilder and the identifier is quite random.

data.title: Dune 2000 updates
data.body: I will start pushing the latest improvements here.

data.title: Feature Request: Selecting a primary Airfield / Helipad for production
data.body:
Feature Request: Selecting a primary Airfield / Helipad for production

The headline says it all.
For any reason you can't do it already, while it works for barracks, weapon factories and even docks.

data.title: undead yak
data.body: http://imgur.com/vOxPQ is a health=0 yak which does not respond to orders anymore even though I can select it. Seems that it does not be able to crash (maybe because of the tree/cliff). It even survived me loosing the game and enemy bazooka soldiers shooting it endlessly.

data.title: Allies 01 map updates and Einstein
data.body: Improved the mission and the map a bit, and added Einstein https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2225

data.title: fixed PlayerColorPalette in Editor
data.body: Making the remapping more customizable broke the editor.

data.title: [d2k] change mouse pointer on terrain types
data.body: Dune 2000 has it's own movement mouse-pointer for infantry-only "Rough" terrain. I would say it's a low-priority wish.

data.title: varying unit prices
data.body:
The Dune 2000 starport is some kind of a market where you can buy vehicles. It's prices vary around a maximum percentage to the actual costs (cheaper and more expensive). I don't know if it could be added to ProductionAirdrop so easily.

data.title: [d2k] weapon that changes the owner of the unit
data.body: The http://dune2k.com/Duniverse/Games/Dune2000/Details/SpecialUnits Deviator fires a (chemical?) warhead which changes the allegiance of the vehicle (for a limited time). [It does not really make sense that it works on tanks but not on infantry.] A weapon like that could also be useful for a vehicle thief unit in RA.

data.title: [d2k] aircrafts with multiple frames for moving into one direction
data.body: The http://dune.wikia.com/wiki/Ornithopter is a flapping helicopter. It works more like the infantry which has run sequences with length > 1.

data.title: Fundaments for buildings, concrete plates
data.body: Dune 2000 requires to build concrete plates below buildings to give the 100% health. It was suggested to implement this with the terrain overlay feature used for bridges and resources. To make it less annoying in multiplayer matches the mappers could place some concrete around the spawn points in the map editor. Putting it into the defense build tab would allow building a aside of a new building.

data.title: Allow connection of 2 wall types
data.body: In Dune 2000 the turrets can be placed onto walls or connect with existing walls like the GDI defense structures in Tiberian Sun.

data.title: Support resource tiles with edges for Dune 2000 spice
data.body: In Dune 2000 the spice resource has not only different densities, but also corners and spice/sand transition tiles for each side. It is also part of the terrain (not an SHP) though it could be converted into multiple SHPs.

data.title: Dropships that pick up units
data.body:
In the Dune 2000 mod the carryalls are currently helicopters that can transport a vehicle. It lands and then a vehicle can enter it like infantry into the Chinook. It should be the other way round. The user should select the carryall dropship and right-click a vehicle to pick up.

The original Dune 2000 has auto-piloted carryalls.
- They pick up harvesters and transport them to the refinery and back to the resource fields.
- When you click with the repair wrench on a vehicle a carryall will pick it up and transport it to a repair pad.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: Sandworm that eats whole units
data.body:
The http://dune.wikia.com/wiki/Sandworm is something that has to be in the game. In Dune 2000 the thumper infantry which spawn a worm even makes it a weapon for multiplayer matches. It should behave like a moving anti-vehicle mine. In my early experiments it uses wormsigns to indicate it's position all the time. In the original it had moving sand tiles (maybe a palette rotation?) and only occasional wormsigns (there different ones which should occur randomly). It will also trigger the audio-notifier "wormsigns". AttackWander and TerrainSpeeds work fine for a worm that goes through the sand only.

I already tried to use the existing weapons.
- AttackLeap was too powerful as it instantly killed stuff occasionally without disappearing. Also the dog bark seemed hard-coded and you could not see the worm attacking.
- (anti vehicle) mines make more sense. The explosion could be the worm mouth and when it ate a unit it should disappear (in the original it eats 3 units). However the units never triggered the explosions. Might be incompatible to the combination of movement.

<bountysource-plugin>

data.title: small Dune 2000 update
data.body: This adds a harmless sandworm, an ugly harvester unload animation and otherwise mostly notifications that I made race specific because Dune 2000 has 3 different announcer voices. However I still need help with #2214 because EvaAlerts can not even be defined multiple times "A definition of EvaAlertsInfo already exists in the dictionary" in system.yaml and I don't know why some Traits can be defined only once and others not.

data.title: Merge CNC and RA settings code
data.body: As titled

data.title: Replaced most uses of `int2` and `float2` with specific types for cell and pixel positions / vectors
data.body:
This will need quite a bit of testing to ensure that I didn't break anything.

I did find a few type errors, mostly around the `Target.FromPos` function. Other than that, this was quality code to begin with so it was relatively painless (albeit exhausting) to patch up the types!

data.title: Harvester cooperation improvements
data.body: Made many harvester behavior improvements. See new commit details.

data.title: Add WaitFor(predicate) activity
data.body: This will simplify various mission scripting tasks.

data.title: Fixed socket code constantly throwing exceptions
data.body: Added `socket.Poll` call to return early if no data is available. Using `socket.Receive` will throw an exception on a non-blocking socket if no data is available because it must not block.
